concepts.concept_name: Reading and writing four-digit numbers and number names

Comparison and ordering of four-digit numbers
Forming greatest and smallest numbers using given digits

in_scope: Place value: thousands, hundreds, tens, ones
Face value vs place value distinction
Forming greatest and smallest numbers with and without repetition
Successor and predecessor of a number
Counting forward and backward in ones, tens, hundreds, thousands
out_of_scope: Numbers beyond 9999 (5-digit numbers) — Introduced in Class 4
Indian and international place value systems — Introduced in Class 4
Numbers up to 999 only — Covered in Class 2
Negative numbers — Introduced in Class 5

concepts.concept_name: Understanding the value of each digit in a number
Decomposition and composition of numbers
Regrouping numbers (e.g., 3 thousands = 30 hundreds)
Building numbers using place value blocks
Word problems involving place value

in_scope: Value of each digit based on its position
Breaking numbers into thousands, hundreds, tens, ones
Composing numbers from place value components
Using base-ten blocks to represent numbers
Word problems requiring place value understanding
out_of_scope: Tens and ones only — Covered in Class 1
Hundreds place introduction — Covered in Class 2
Place value beyond thousands (ten thousands, lakhs) — Introduced in Class 4
Decimal place value — Introduced in Class 4

concepts.concept_name: Rounding numbers to nearest 10 and nearest 100
Estimation of sums, differences, and products
Checking reasonableness of answers using estimation
Practical applications of estimation

in_scope: Checking if an answer is reasonable
out_of_scope: Rounding to nearest 1000 — Introduced in Class 4
Rounding decimals — Introduced in Class 4
Formal estimation techniques — Introduced in Class 5

concepts.concept_name: Even and odd numbers (up to 1000)
Skip counting by 2s, 3s, 4s, 5s, 6s, 7s, 8s, 9s, 10s, 25s, 50s, 100s
Ordinal numbers: first to hundredth (1st to 100th)
Cardinal and ordinal number relationship
Number patterns and sequences

in_scope: Properties: even + even = even, odd + odd = even, even + odd = odd
Skip counting in various intervals up to 100s
Relationship between cardinal and ordinal numbers
Number patterns and finding missing terms
out_of_scope: Skip counting by 2s and 5s only — Covered in Class 1
Prime and composite numbers — Introduced in Class 4
Factors and multiples — Introduced in Class 4
Algebraic patterns — Introduced in Class 5

concepts.concept_name: Reading and writing Roman numerals from I to XX (1 to 20)
Understanding symbols: I, V, X, L (1, 5, 10, 50)
Converting between Hindu-Arabic and Roman numerals
Understanding the subtraction principle (IV, IX)

in_scope: Roman numerals I to XX (1 to 20)
Addition rule: smaller after larger adds (e.g., VI = 6)
Subtraction rule: smaller before larger subtracts (e.g., IV = 4, IX = 9)
Converting Hindu-Arabic to Roman numerals and vice versa
out_of_scope: Roman numerals beyond XX (beyond 20) — Extended in Class 4
Symbols C, D, M (100, 500, 1000) — Introduced in Class 4
Roman numeral arithmetic — Not in primary curriculum

concepts.concept_name: Addition without regrouping and with regrouping (carrying)
Column addition of 3-digit and 4-digit numbers
Addition of three or more numbers
Properties of addition: commutative, associative, identity
Mental addition strategies and estimation of sums
Word problems involving addition

in_scope: Addition of numbers up to 4 digits
Commutative property: a + b = b + a
Associative property: (a + b) + c = a + (b + c)
out_of_scope: Addition within 20 only — Covered in Class 1
Addition within 999 only — Covered in Class 2
Addition of 5-digit numbers and beyond — Introduced in Class 4
Addition of decimals — Introduced in Class 4

concepts.concept_name: Subtraction without regrouping and with regrouping (borrowing)

Word problems involving subtraction

in_scope: Subtraction of numbers up to 4 digits

out_of_scope: Subtraction within 20 only — Covered in Class 1
Subtraction within 999 only — Covered in Class 2
Subtraction of 5-digit numbers and beyond — Introduced in Class 4

concepts.concept_name: Multiplication tables 2 to 20 (memorization and application)

Properties of multiplication: commutative, associative, distributive
Multiplication by 10, 100, and 1000

out_of_scope: Multiplication tables up to 10 only — Covered in Class 2

Multiplication of 3-digit by 2-digit numbers — Introduced in Class 4

concepts.concept_name: Understanding division as equal sharing and grouping

Understanding quotient and remainder
Checking division: Dividend = (Divisor × Quotient) + Remainder
Division by 10 and 100
Word problems involving division

in_scope: Division as equal sharing and grouping
Word problems with single division operation
out_of_scope: Basic division concept only — Covered in Class 2
Division of 4-digit or 5-digit numbers — Introduced in Class 4
Division by 2-digit divisors — Introduced in Class 4
Long division algorithm — Introduced in Class 4
Decimal quotients — Introduced in Class 5

concepts.concept_name: Problems involving two or more operations

Larger numerator means larger fraction (same denominator)

out_of_scope: Comparing unlike-denominator fractions — Introduced in Class 4

Comparing fractions with different numerators and denominators — Introduced in Class 4

concepts.concept_name: Finding fraction of a collection of objects
